result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby C Burton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: $204.00 payable to Jessica B., to be satisfied before costs and surcharges.

Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, if not already done so. Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including restitution surcharge during term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised the defendant he must provide a DNA sample, if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if conditions under the statue are met.

- Attend and successfully complete a Batterers Intervention program.
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting Class.
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
- Mental Health Evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Take all prescribed medication.
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety (except for prescribed medication).
- Random screens.
- No drugs without a valid prescription.
- No Contact with the victim without approval of agent.
- 3rd party contact for purposes of child visitation.
- Court sets restitution in the amount of $204.00
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSD.
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-15.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; for the use at the discretion of the probation department

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby C Burton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.   rmm
Probation Review hearing scheduled for 11-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by Jessica B., Margaret J., the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court ordered defendant to serve  90  DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 20 days served.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he must provide a DNA sample, if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if conditions under the statute are met. 

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  18  MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered 20 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department. 
- Attend and successfully complete a Batterers Intervention program
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- Mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Take all prescribed medication
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety (except for prescribed medication)
- Random screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim without approval of the agent
- Court sets Restitution in the amount of $204
- 3rd party contact for purposes of child visitation
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSD
- Pay Restitution in the amount of $204 to Jessica B.  Restitution to be satisfied before costs, fees and surcharges owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-2015.

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
State files copy of letter to the court from victim.

Defendant Bobby C Burton in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Bobby C Burton in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms
Telephone call received from defense counsel requesting adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 40 on 08-11-2015 at 1:30 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for 08-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Bobby C Burton not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests brief adjournment.  Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLB dob 4/19/90 or JT dob 4/20/88

Defendant Bobby C Burton in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Bobby C Burton in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Bobby C Burton
Current: 2621 W Pierce Street, Milwaukee, WI 53214   (Effective: 07-24-2015)
Prior: 2203 West Forest Home Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
